article:
{{Infobox single 
| Name = Beautiful Cover = 02_-_Beautiful.jpg Artist = Christina Aguilera Album
| = Stripped B-side = "Dame Lo Que Yo Te Doy" Released = November 16, 2002

"'Beautiful'" is a song recorded by American singer Christina Aguilera. The song
was written and produced by Linda Perry for Aguilera's fourth studio album,
[[Stripped (Christina Aguilera album)|Stripped]] (2002). A pop ballad, it tells
the story of a woman who is fighting against low self-esteem and insecurity
issues; its main message is about inner beauty and not letting other people's
opinions and words disturb one's peace of mind. It is consider by many as
Aguilera's signature song.

RCA released "Beautiful" to American radio stations on January 16, as the second
single of the album. The song became a commercial success, topping the charts in
Australia, Canada, Ireland, New Zealand, and the United Kingdom. In the United
States it peaked at number two on the Billboard Hot 100 chart. The single was
certified platinum by the Australian Recording Industry Association (ARIA), and
gold by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA) and the Recording
Industry Association of New Zealand (RIANZ).

"Beautiful" received general acclaim from critics and has been noted as one of
Aguilera's strongest singles. The song won the Grammy Award for Best Female Pop
Vocal Performance at the 2004 ceremony and was also nominated for Song of the
Year. It was ranked number 52 on [[Rolling Stone]]s Top 100 songs of the decade,
and at number 18 on VH1s 100 Greatest Songs of '00s list. Notable performers
such as Elvis Costello, David Archuleta, Kenny G and Chaka Khan have recorded
covers of the song.

The song was embraced as an anthem by the LGBT community because of its message
of self-empowerment and inner beauty. The Jonas Ãkerlund directed music video
earned Aguilera a GLAAD Media Award for its positive portrayal of gay and
transgender people. In 2011, UK LGBT Rights organization Stonewall named
"Beautiful" the most empowering song of the previous decade for gay, lesbian and
bisexual people.
categories: Billboard Hot Dance Club Songs number-one singles
Billboard Mainstream Top 40 (Pop Songs) number-one singles
Music videos directed by Jonas Åkerlund
headings: Cover versions, usage in media and in popular culture
